ovdesc.p: This is the main Swap contract file.

The details supporting the swap transaction will be held on a single contract. A Swap contract consists of two legs, Asset and Liability, both of which are maintained on the contract. It stores details of the counterparty of the swap, the notional principal(s), rates, schedules for both swap legs, payment instructions etc. A swap contract is an agreement to exchange interest payments in a fixed obligation for interest payments in a floating rate obligation (Interest Rate Swap), or one currency for another (Currency Swap), and reverse the exchange at a later date.

An Interest Rate Swap (IRS) contract is a contract in which two counterparties agree to exchange interest payments of differing character based on an underlying notional principal amount that is never exchanged.

In a Currency Interest Rate Swap (CIRS) contract the underlying principal amount is usually real (not notional) and is usually exchanged (Principal Exchange PX and Principal Re-exchange RX schedules).
Typically, a swap contract exchanges fixed rate obligations for a floating rate instrument in the same currency for an IRS contract and different currencies for a CIRS contract.

In its simplest form, the two parties to an Interest Rate Swap exchange the interest payment obligations (IRS - no principal changes hands, CIRS - principal changes hands) on two different kinds of debt instruments, one being a fixed interest rate, the other being a floating rate.
The following are examples of Interest Swaps :
Coupon swap or exchange of fixed rate for floating rate instruments in the same currency
Basis swaps or the exchange of floating rate to floating rate instruments in the same currency.
Cross currency interest rate swaps involving the exchange of fixed rate instruments in one currency for floating rate in another.
Exchange of floating rate to floating rate instruments in different currencies.
Payment Freq. : Both fixed and floating rate payments made semi-annually.

A Foreign Exchange (FOREX) swap differs from an Interest Rate Swap (See Foreign Exchange module for more information on FOREX swaps). A Foreign Exchange swap contract within the FOREX application is the simultaneous buying and selling of a currency in approximately equal amounts for different maturity dates. The swap price is the difference in price between the two maturity dates of the swap.

desc.p: This field displays the Swap activity code, as defined on the SWAP.ACTIVITY file, for which the delivery message was raised.
This field is a no-input field and is part of a multi-valued set.
Example Swap Activity codes :
o 101 Contract confirmation o 102 Principal exchange o 103 Principal increase/decrease o 110 Payment of premium o 202 Payment
3 Numeric characters. (No-input field. Default = Automatically updated by the system).

The reference number input in this field will be printed on all advices and confirmations etc. with the bank's contract number.
This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract.

Specifies the date and frequency of the schedule.

The date of the schedule is defined along with the frequency of future process dates of the schedule. Schedules can be processed on any day of the month and at a frequency of either daily, monthly, quarterly, half-yearly, or yearly.
When a schedule is processed :
o If the schedule has no frequency then the schedule is removed from the swap contract.

o If the schedule has a frequency then the next process date is updated according to the frequency. Eg. Schedule processed on 01 Jan 95 frequency M0101, then the date.freq field is updated with 01 Feb 95 frequency M0101.
The swap balance file, "SWAP.BALANCES", is updated accordingly.
16 Character standard date/frequency code format (type A FREQ). (Mandatory input if the associated schedule type has been defined).
A frequency is disallowed for "PX" and "RX" schedules.
For all schedules, the date must be GE the value date of the contract and LE the maturity date of the contract.
The date must be equal to the Liability interest effective date for schedule type "PX".
The date must be greater than the liability interest effective date and today for schedule type "IP" (Interest payment).
If schedule type is IP or AP and Day convention is Following or Modified then daily and business day freq is not allowed.
Identifies the counterparty with whom the Bank makes the contract.

This is the identification assigned to the Customer on first contact with the bank. The customer will be referred to by this identification in all subsequent operations with the Bank. The system will make use of this number to:
a) Identify the Counterparty of the transaction engaged in by the Bank,
b) Print the Customer's name and address on all contracts and/or advices produced by this module,
c) Locate the liability number for limit checking on Placement contracts.
3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or, 1-10 numeric character customer number. (Mandatory input).
Must be a valid Customer number or mnemonic.
Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed.
Specifies whether the current interest amount payments on the liability leg are of a fixed or floating amount.
This field is a no-input field and is set to either "Y" for fixed interest amounts, and "NO" (default) for floating interest amounts.
This field is determined by the interest payment schedules ("IP") defined on the Asset side of the contract.

o If the IP schedule (LB.TYPE) has an amount specified (LB.AMOUNT) then fixed interest is "Y". o If the IP schedule (LB.TYPE) does not have an amount specified (LB.AMOUNT) then fixed interest is "NO".
1-2 Alpha characters. "Y" signifies a fixed interest amount for the current period. "NO" signifies a floating interest amount for the current period. (No-input field. Default = "NO").

Contains the amount of brokerage to be paid to the broker defined above. The brokerage will be expressed in either the asset currency or the liability currency depending on the value in the BROKERAGE.BASE field.

If no value is entered here but a broker code is defined above, then the system will attempt to calculate a default brokerage amount based on the conditions set up on the BROKER file. If an amount is calculated succesfully then it will be defaulted in this field.

Valid definitions are as follows :
o null All accounting entries are to be posted to the corresponding settlement account number.
o PAYMENT Only "payment" accounting entries are to be posted to the corresponding settlement account number.
o RECEIPT Only "receipt" accounting entries are to be posted to the corresponding settlement account number.
The set up of this field should be either :
o null or, o a set of defined instructions for both "PAYMENT" and "RECEIPT".
The main key to the settlement instructions to identify the associated account number is the Currency (SET.CURRENCY).

If a set of settlement instructions for a currency is defined with a type of "PAYMENT", and a set of associated instructions for "RECEIPT" is not defined, then the same settlement account will be used for both payment and receipt type entries.

Note: T24 allows the user to define, on Floating rate contracts, a spread which can be added to or subtracted from the percentage interest rate related to the INTEREST KEY. The subtraction of the INTEREST SPREAD from the INTEREST KEY must be specifically indicated by the insertion of the '-' (minus) sign in front of the INTEREST SPREAD.

Can be any valid type as defined on the SWAP.SCHEDULE.TYPE file. The Swap Schedule Type file defines all of the schedules which are permitted on a Swap contract. Details such as the transaction codes to be used on entries, P&L category codes, Charge codes etc., are also defined on the Swap Schedule Type table.
The first two characters of the schedule type id determine the type of schedule.
When a schedule is processed the Swap balances file (SWAP.BALANCES) is updated accordingly.

Must be a valid definition of the SWAP.SCHEDULE.TYPE file. Different schedules can be added but the first two characters must be one of the specified fixed schedule types.
The schedules AC, AM, AY, CI, and CM, which are system generated schedules, cannot be input by the user.

1-11 type "R" (Rate) numeric characters plus a decimal point.
Identifies the start date of the first interest period and therefore the true Value date of the Asset leg.
It is the date on which interest accruals commence on the outstanding balance of the contract.
This date can be entered as either the current date (today) or a date in the past (less than the contract value date). It cannot be greater than the contract value date.

If forward dated, ie. both the value date and interest effective date are forward, then the contract status will be null until the effective date is reached, at which time, the principal amount will be drawn down and the contract status changed to "CUR".
An input of a null value will result in the date being defaulted to the contract value date.
If backdated or 'today' dated then the contract will be drawn down, put on-line, and the contract status set to "CUR".
If backdated into a prior month, interest will be accrued on-line up to the end of the previous month.
Input of a non working day will require an override.
Standard Date format.
Defaults to the contract Value Date.
Cannot be greater than the contract Value Date.
Input is prohibited was the contract status has been set to "CUR" (Current).
An override will be required if this date is a non-working day.
A unique reference number which identifies a particular Swap contract.

Contract numbers can be generated either manually or automatically. Where automatic generation is supported depression of the F3 key at the "Awaiting ID" prompt supplies the next available contract number.

To avoid the necessity to manually input the complete reference number (contract number), the User has the facility to input only the sequence number of the transaction which has been input that day. The Application will automatically generate the seven first digits and append them to the front of the sequence number in order to retrieve the requested transaction. Access to any Swap transaction from a previous day requires the input of the corresponding julian day and year if the contract has been done in a previous year.
The reference has the following format SWyydddnnnnn, where :

o SW = Application indicator for the Swaps application. o yy = The last two digits of the year when the transaction is processed. o ddd = Julian day number within the year when the Swap transaction is processed. o nnnnn = Five digit sequential number.
The above numbering convention enables 99,999 deals to be struck on any one day.

When a deal is to be confirmed (using the Verify function) the type of confirmation (either customer or broker) may be defined by prefixing either CU (for customer confirmations) or BR (for broker confirmations) to the contract number of the deal to be confirmed. If this prefix is missing and the deal is to be verified the user will be requested to specify which type of confirmation is required. Once the prefix is chosen it remains the same until changed (i.e. the prefix can be specified once and then omitted for subsequent contracts).

Certain versions will automatically append the BR or CU prefix to the contract number. If the prefix BR or CU is present during any other function it will be removed from the contract number and will have no effect on the processing of the contract.
10 numeric characters, prefixed by "SW" : SWyydddnnnnn - SW followed by 10N (See details). (Mandatory Input).
If the reference number is entered, during initial input, it will be validated for uniqueness.
When input, this field will only be allowed in the format above.
This transaction number can never be changed.
Defines the final date for the schedule.
If a schedule is defined with a process date and frequency (AS.DATE.FREQ) then the final process date is the date defined in this field.
16 Alpha-numeric standard date format. (Optional input. No default).
Defines the current status of the Swap contract.
The following values are possible :

o null contract either unauthorised, or has not yet reached the contract Value Date, ie. the contract is forward. o CUR contract has reached the contract Value Date, ie. the contract is current ("live"). o MAT contract has Matured.
This no-input field is automatically updated.
1-3 Alpha-numeric characters. (No-input field. Default = the status of the contract.).
Identifies the leg type associated with the set of Delivery details.
Will be defined as A (asset) or L (liability).
1 Alpha character. (No-input. Default = Swap leg type "A" or "L").
Defines the type of date adjustments that are to be followed on the Liability leg.
Depending on the date adjustment, the process date of the schedules and the interest effective dates are calculated.
Valid date adjustments and their effects are as follows :
DATE.ADJUSTMENT ENTRY.DATE EFFECTIVE.DATE =============== ========== ==============
o null SCHEDULE.DATE SCHEDULE.DATE o VALUE PROCESS.DATE SCHEDULE.DATE o PERIOD PROCESS.DATE PROCESS.DATE
Where,
ENTRY.DATE is the process date of the schedule determined by the Date Adjustment specified (LB.DATE.ADJUSTMENT).
EFFECTIVE.DATE is the end date of the current interest period determined by the Date Adjustment specified (LB.DATE.ADJUSTMENT).
SCHEDULE.DATE is the date of the schedule as specified in the swap contract (LB.DATE.FREQ).
PROCESS.DATE is the process date of the schedule determined by the Asset Day Convention (LB.DAY.CONVENTION).
1-6 Alpha-numeric characters. (Optional input. Default = null).
Must be set to either "null", "VALUE", or "PERIOD".
Defines the Day Convention to follow.
Based on the Day Convention (LB.DAY.CONVENTION) and the Business Centres (LB.BUS.CENTRES) the process date of the Liability leg schedules are determined.
Valid Day Conventions are as follows :
o null the process date is the date of the schedule.
o FOLLOWING the process date is the next business day after the date of the schedule.

o MODIFIED the process date is the next business day after the date of the schedule providing this date does not fall into the next calendar month. In which case the process date is the first preceding business day.
o PRECEDING the process date is the first preceding business day.
1-10 Alpha-numeric characters. (Optional input. Default = null).
Valid Day Conventions are either "null", "FOLLOWING", "PRECEDING", or "MODIFIED".
Indicates those countries whose calendars must be checked with regard to holiday (working day) validation.

The default value will be the Country of the currency of the Asset side of the contract, but additional Country codes can be manually input if required. For example, the country codes of the participants and/or the Liability leg.
2 Alpha characters. (Optional input. Multi-valued field).
The code must be a a valid definition on the COUNTRY table and must have a valid entry on the REGION/HOLIDAY table.
Defaulted to the Country of the Asset leg Currency.

This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC.
There are three options available: AUTOMATIC SEMI-AUTOMATIC MANUAL
AUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract.
MANUAL will create a PD contract instead.
SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account. For further details see the helptext in PD.PARAMETER where these settings are controlled from.
If the PD product is not installed for the current company then the only allowed setting is AUTOMATIC.
Only AUTOMATIC allowed for liability contract types.

In this case the value 'OTHER' is used in field 14F on the SWIFT message and the value in this field is used.
This field will not be used if the liability leg is fixed.

Identifies the start date of the first interest period and therefore the true Value date of the Liability leg.
It is the date on which interest accruals commence on the outstanding balance of the contract.
This date can be entered as either the current date (today) or a date in the past (less than the contract value date). It cannot be greater than the contract value date.

If forward dated, ie. both the value date and interest effective date are forward, then the contract status will be null until the effective date is reached, at which time, the principal amount will be drawn down and the contract status changed to "CUR".
An input of a null value will result in the date being defaulted to the contract value date.
If backdated or 'today' dated then the contract will be drawn down, put on-line, and the contract status set to "CUR".
If backdated into a prior month, interest will be accrued on-line up to the end of the previous month.
Input of a non working day will require an override.

All Trades should have a Unique Transaction Identifier (UTI) which is generated, communicated and matched
Determination of who generates the UTI should follow the existing industry best practices for that Asset class
The UTI.USI.API attached in OC.PARAMETER and invoked during FRA deal capture determines who is the party responsible for UTI generation and does the following.
• If a value is present during deal capture the API is not invoked, on the assumption that the UTI is generated and supplied by the other Counterparty.

• If no value is present during the deal capture, the API is invoked to determine the party responsible for generating the UTI. If the Other counterparty is responsible, still an UTI is generated with a suffix as TEMP to show that the UTI from the other counterparty is awaited and in the meantime, the reporting is done with a Temporary ID. If T24 Bank is responsible for UTI generation, then the same is generated without TEMP.
• Where a reporting has been made with UTI having TEMP as suffix and subsequently the Counterparty supplies the UTI, the following procedure has to be followed to ensure reporting with actual UTI.

• The field Action Type needs to be changed to ‘E’ and record to be authorized. Later, the UTI field should be modified with the actual UTI received. Set the Action Type field to ‘N’ and authorize the record. In this way, the previous reporting gets cancelled and the new reporting goes with correct UTI.
Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed.
can contain up to 52 alphanumeric characters

Part of Regulatory Reporting information to a Trade Repository.

Under the Regulatory Reporting to a Trade Repository, it is not only the initial trade that is reported but also the life cycle events of the Trade that follow. A change in the action type is indicative of an event on the contract and requires to be reported. Change in Action Types is allowed both manually and automatically.
Specifies the ACTION.TYPE that is populated based on the event on trade.
Input to this field is allowed only when OC module is installed.
Allowed optional values are N, M, E, C, Z and O
N denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is NEW. Value of 'N' is defaulted for a new contract. User is also allowed to change the status to N if the previous status is E.

E denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is REVERSE or Correction. In case of wrongly entered UTI values or a Temporary UTI was used previously, the old UTI should be reported with ACTION.TYPE as 'E' for error reporting first and then change the Action Type to NEW after keying in the actual UTI. This way the previous reporting with temporary UTI is replaced by the one with final UTI. Action Type ‘E’ is also used to undo the reporting of a particular transaction done which should not have been done reported at all in the first instance.
M denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is MODIFIED. In case of change in the RATE.FIXING.DATE the ACTION.TYPE is set to 'M'.

C denotes that the ACTION.TYPE is CANCELLED. In case of any change in maturity/value date i.e. early termination of the contract should be reported with C. In FRA this MATURITY.DATE field is No change field. So ACTION.TYPE never gets populated automatically with type as C but It can be manually updated as ‘c’ and the contract can be cancelled.
Z denotes Compression update. This means the trade being reported is generated out of a compression activity.
O denotes OTHER types. When OTHER is used, additional information as to what OTHER mean should be mentioned separately.

when OC.CLG.STATUS of the contract is SUBMITTED both CLG.MEM.ID and CENTRAl.CLG.PARTY fields cannot be NULL.

REJECTED - when the contract is rejected by the Trade Repository it should get updated as REJECTED.

CLEARED - When the status of the contract is ACCEPTED, User is expected to reverse the contract and enter a new one with Trade status as CLEARED.

Terminated - A cleared contract when cancelled/terminated by the Trade Repository should be updated as TERMINATED.
The previous status should be CLEARED.
